result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominique M Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: *Huber privileges, credit for 4 days time served.  The Court objects to Electronic Monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
*Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge.
*Pay all applicable mandatory costs, surcharges, fees, and assessments, by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
*The Court ordered restitution set at zero.
*No illegal drugs; agent to assess AODA needs.
*Attend and successfully complete Anger management and Parenting class.

records.addlTxt:
Amended Information filed on today for the purpose of complete record.

NOTE: *charge orally amended at plea hearing held on 8-31-15*
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to BATTERY, contrary to Wis. Stats. sec. 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Dominique M Riley in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Court vacates the 9/2/2015 jury trial date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motions in Limine received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed.

Defendant Dominique M Riley in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense is requesting an adjournment of the 9/2/2015 jury trial date to complete investigation.   State objects.  Defense argues and adds additional information requesting an adjournment.  Court orders case adjourned for a final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Dominique M Riley in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 6.

Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dominique M Riley in court with attorney James Rael.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rael's motion to substitute in as counsel granted by the court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique M Riley in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Nathaniel Adamson for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 6/9/15.

Defendant Dominique M Riley in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Dominique M Riley in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
